overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish an adjudication system and procedures to process fireworks infractions. [1] This bill also amends and establishes various definitions and penalties for firework offenses, including establishing heightened penalties under certain circumstances, and establishes various criminal offenses and penalties related to fireworks or articles pyrotechnics. [1] The Act also appropriates funds to carry out its purposes. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ (HB1483_.HTM.txt) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The funds are to carry out the purposes of this Act, including to update the judiciary information management system to implement the adjudications process established by section 2 of this Act. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]

agency_impact: This bill establishes a dedicated adjudication system for fireworks infractions, which will impact the judiciary by requiring it to process these cases. [1] The judiciary's information management system will need to be updated to implement the new adjudications process. [1] Law enforcement agencies will be responsible for issuing notices of infraction, and county fire department officers will act as inspectors with authority to enter and inspect premises. [1] [1]
economic_impact: The legislature finds that the widespread use of illegal fireworks poses an extreme danger and lethal risk to public health and safety, resulting in fires, serious burn injuries, and fatalities. [1] This measure is intended to reduce the societal costs associated with illegal fireworks by improving enforcement. [1] The bill also generates revenue through new fines and fees, such as a $20 (HB1483_.HTM.txt) administrative fee for each infraction [1], a $25 (HB1483_.HTM.txt) permit fee for firecrackers [1], and fines ranging from $500 (HB1483_.HTM.txt) to $5,000 (HB1483_.HTM.txt) for certain violations. [1]
policy_impact: This Act establishes a new chapter in the Hawaii Revised Statutes to create a dedicated adjudication system for fireworks infractions, similar to the existing traffic infraction system. [1] The measure amends multiple definitions and penalties for fireworks offenses and establishes various new criminal offenses related to fireworks. [1] It also confers concurrent jurisdiction on district courts to hear and dispose of cases of fireworks infractions by children. [1]
revenue_sources: Revenue to support the bill's provisions will be generated from monetary assessments, fees, and fines. [1] A permit for consumer fireworks known as firecrackers requires a fee of $25 (HB1483_.HTM.txt), while a permit for aerial devices requires a fee of $110 (HB1483_.HTM.txt). [1] [1] The court shall impose an administrative fee of $20 (HB1483_.HTM.txt) for each fireworks infraction, which is deposited into the judiciary computer system special fund, and fines collected are split with eighty per cent to the county and twenty per cent to the State.
